content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
───────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
Consists of the following components that together form the factory interface for copper cable production:
• New factory burner inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5) – intended as the initial target for extraction connection.
• Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5) – serving as the input interface.
• Dedicated burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) using direction RIGHT – positioned adjacent to the input chest and linked (via neighboring entities) to downstream assembling machinery.

### Belt Depot at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
This structure is designed to act as an isolated belt target for routing items from the extraction system:
• Wooden chest at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) – crafted and placed to serve as the depot.
• Transport belt segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) – positioned immediately adjacent to the depot chest.
• Depot burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) using direction UP – installed next to the depot chest to facilitate belt connectivity.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Belt Connection Targeting Issues  
  – Repeated errors (Steps 210, 211, 213, 214, 215, 216, and 217) indicate that transport belts are being attempted to connect directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object.  
  – To avoid this, always route the belt connection to an inserter configured to receive items rather than targeting a steam engine.

• Wooden Chest Placement Failures  
  – Errors include failure to place a wooden chest because the target position is too far (distance exceeded the allowed limit), missing the item in inventory, and referencing an undefined variable (‘target_chest’).  
  – Ensure that the player is close enough to the target placement area, verify that the required wooden chest is available in the inventory before attempting placement, and check variable names for consistency.
